chat.msg: Welcome!
Hello!
Hello! Welcome to our navigation game. Are you ready to begin?
yes
Great! Let's get started. You are currently at the top-right corner of the map. Can you see a small island a few steps to your left?
yes
Fantastic! Now, carefully make your way towards that small island. Make sure to stay just below the leopard that is resting there. Let me know once you've reached the island.
I'm there.

Wonderful! Now, on the island you're currently on, you'll find a wooden twig that acts as a bridge. Cross over that twig and head towards the larger island where a parrot and an elephant are located. Make sure to go over the head of the parrot and then continue south between the parrot and the elephant. Let me know once you've reached that point.
I'm there.

Great job! Now, from the island with the parrot and the elephant, you need to continue in a south-eastern direction. You'll come across 3 rocks, 2 gray ones and 1 darker one. Cross over these rocks and keep going until you reach the next island. Once you're there, let me know.
I'm there.

Awesome progress! Now, on this new island, you'll find a frog. Go south of the frog and continue until you reach a point where you can make a u-turn to the left (west). Take that u-turn and head back towards the island with the parrot and the elephant. Once you've reached that island again, let me know.
I'm there!

Great job! Now, from the island with the parrot and the elephant, this time we're going to head left (west). Cross over two gray rocks and make your way towards the island with a giraffe. Once you've reached the giraffe's location, make sure to go below it in a south-west direction. Let me know once you've done that.
I've made it!

Fantastic job! Now, from below the giraffe, turn 90 degrees to the left (south-east) and cross over to another island. On this island, you will find a snake. Go over the snake and continue until you reach the final objective of our journey: the treasure. Let me know once you've reached the treasure.

chat.msg: Welcome!
Hello!
Hello! Welcome to our map adventure! Are you ready to start navigating?
Yes, I am ready!
Great! Let's begin. Look around you and find the white dog sitting in the top-right (north-east) corner of the map. Can you see it?
yes, I do see the dog.
Fantastic! Now, take a few steps to your left (west) and you will come across a wooden bench. Can you find the bench?
Yes, I am at the bench.
Perfect! From the bench, continue straight ahead and you will see a stream. Cross the stream and head towards the florist stand. Can you find the stand?
I am now at the stand.
Great job! Now, make a left turn (west) and cross the stream again, heading back towards the white dog. Can you see the stream and the white dog?
Yes. I crossed the stream and am now back at the dog's spot

Awesome! Just near the white dog, you will see a wooden branch crossing a river. Cross over the branch to the south and continue heading southwards (down the map). Can you locate the branch and cross over it?
I have crossed
Fantastic! Keep moving southwards and you will come across another white dog sitting next to a red and white checkered picnic. Can you see the dog and the picnic?
Yes!
Great! Move over the picnic mat, but be careful not to touch the bowl of berries on it. Then, continue heading west. Can you see the bowl of berries and move past it?
Yes, I have made it without touching the berries.
Well done! Now, keep going west until you reach a wooden branch that crosses the river again, this time to the north. Can you locate the branch and cross the river once more?
Yes!
Great job! After crossing the river, you will see a green bush. Instead of going straight towards the bush, circle around it from the right side. Can you navigate around the bush without touching it?
I did it successfully!
Fantastic! Now, you should see the florist stand. Head towards the stand and once you reach it, make a left turn (west). Can you find the stand and turn left?
yes!
Awesome! Now, go below the stand and you will see a big bridge with two people riding a bicycle. Pass to the west side of the bridge. Can you find the bridge and move to the west side of it?
Yes

Great job! Just after the bridge, you will see two elderly people sitting on a bench and reading newspapers. Take a few steps south, passing between the old people and another wooden branch. Can you find the old people and pass between them and the branch?
yes
Excellent! Now, you should see a green bush next to the end of the wooden branch. Head east, between the branch and the bush. Can you navigate between the branch and the bush?
yes
Awesome! Just a few steps to the east, you will come across a brown young deer. Congratulations, you have reached the final destination! Well done on following the path!

chat.msg: Welcome!
Hello!
Hello there! Are you ready to embark on a fun navigation challenge? Let's begin by standing at the opening of the tent. Can you see it?
Yes! I see it!
Fantastic! Now, take a few steps south from the tent and find yourself on a trail. Can you locate the trail? Let me know when you're there!
I'm there!
Great job! Now, continue heading east on the trail until you come across a cute little puppy. Can you spot the puppy? Let me know when you find it!
I see him!
Awesome! Now, make a left turn under the puppy and keep heading east. Soon, you'll reach a small bonfire that's north of the trail. Can you spot the bonfire? Let me know when you're there!
I'm there

Perfect! Now, instead of going straight, go to the left (north) of the bonfire and continue heading east on the trail. Keep going until you pass under two red mushrooms. Can you see the mushrooms? Let me know when you've passed them!
I've passed them

Great job! Now, as you continue east on the trail, you'll spot a blue car. But here's a little twist, instead of touching the car, make a right U-turn and start heading back west. Let me know when you've made the U-turn!
made the turn!

Fantastic! Now, as you head west, you'll reach a fork in the trail. Take the left (south) branch of the trail. Keep following it until you pass east of a telescope. Can you spot the telescope? Let me know when you've gone past it!
yes!
Great work! Now, after passing the telescope, veer right and take a short off-trail shortcut around it. Keep going until you're back on the trail. Let me know when you've rejoined the trail!
I'm back

Awesome! Now that you're back on the trail, continue heading west. Soon, you'll notice a low wall of rocks surrounding a wooden cabin. Your final destination is that cabin! Can you see it? Let me know when you've reached the cabin!

general_survey.answer: No, I have not. A few of my family members do speak French, though.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I like it. Sometimes it's necessary to use a word in another language. Sometimes a phrase or word just fits better than in, say, it does in English in the context.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I enjoy studying languages and am always trying to continue bettering my French. I also study Spanish.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
